meanings.definition: Scatter or spread (things) untidily over a surface.
meanings.sent1: She will strow the seeds in the garden for the flowers to grow.
meanings.sent2: Please do not strow your toys all over the living room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel decided to strow acorns all around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to strow the fallen leaves like a painter's brush on the ground.
meanings.sent5: As the magician waved his wand, glitter seemed to strow magically in the air.

meanings.definition: To be scattered or spread untidily over a surface.
meanings.sent1: The papers will strow across the desk if you don't organize them.
meanings.sent2: Leaves tend to strow around the yard during autumn.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy caused the trash to strow all over the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to strow joy and happiness wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The artist's paintbrush seemed to strow colors effortlessly on the canvas.
